title: [BUG] can't load model when use HDFS as artifact store
body:
the traceback : 

```python
      1 import mlflow.pyfunc
      2 import mlflow
----> 3 model = mlflow.pyfunc.load_model(
      4     model_uri=f"models:/LGBModel/6"
      5 )

/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/__init__.py in load_model(model_uri, suppress_warnings)
    649                               messages will be emitted.
    650     """
--> 651     local_path = _download_artifact_from_uri(artifact_uri=model_uri)
    652     model_meta = Model.load(os.path.join(local_path, MLMODEL_FILE_NAME))
    653 

/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/artifact_utils.py in _download_artifact_from_uri(artifact_uri, output_path)
     93         root_uri = prefix + urllib.parse.urlunparse(parsed_uri)
     94 
---> 95     return get_artifact_repository(artifact_uri=root_uri).download_artifacts(
     96         artifact_path=artifact_path, dst_path=output_path
     97     )

/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/models_artifact_repo.py in download_artifacts(self, artifact_path, dst_path)
    108         :return: Absolute path of the local filesystem location containing the desired artifacts.
    109         """
--> 110         return self.repo.download_artifacts(artifact_path, dst_path)
    111 
    112     def _download_file(self, remote_file_path, local_path):

/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/hdfs_artifact_repo.py in download_artifacts(self, artifact_path, dst_path)
    132             if not hdfs.isdir(hdfs_base_path):
    133                 local_path = os.path.join(local_dir, os.path.normpath(artifact_path))
--> 134                 _download_hdfs_file(hdfs, hdfs_base_path, local_path)
    135                 return local_path
    136 

/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/hdfs_artifact_repo.py in _download_hdfs_file(hdfs, remote_file_path, local_file_path)
    224     if not os.path.exists(dirs):
    225         os.makedirs(dirs)
--> 226     with open(local_file_path, "wb") as f:
    227         f.write(hdfs.open(remote_file_path, "rb").read())
    228 

IsADirectoryError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: '/tmp/tmpsos7uut3/.'
```

If I call the function: 
```python
mlflow.pyfunc.load_model("models:/xxx/xxx")
```
It will call into : `_download_artifact_from_uri("models:/xxx/xxx")`, as the uri is a models uri,  the `artifact_path` will be set to empty string [at here](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/d6ae84164987e2881cdffdce07f7dcf0e3d94aaa/mlflow/tracking/artifact_utils.py#L89)
```python
    if ModelsArtifactRepository.is_models_uri(artifact_uri):
        root_uri = artifact_uri
        artifact_path = ""  # set empty here
    else:
        artifact_path = posixpath.basename(parsed_uri.path)
        parsed_uri = parsed_uri._replace(path=posixpath.dirname(parsed_uri.path))
        root_uri = prefix + urllib.parse.urlunparse(parsed_uri)

    return get_artifact_repository(artifact_uri=root_uri).download_artifacts(
        artifact_path=artifact_path, dst_path=output_path
    )
```

and then the `artifact_path` will be used to `download_artifacts` by `HdfsArtifactRepository`,  it should generate a `local_path` for download, but the empty `artifact_path` will generate a directory: 
```python
def download_artifacts(self, artifact_path, dst_path=None):
        # aritfact_path is empty
        hdfs_base_path = _resolve_base_path(self.path, artifact_path)
        local_dir = _tmp_dir(dst_path)
       
        with hdfs_system(scheme=self.scheme, host=self.host, port=self.port) as hdfs:
            # of couse is not dir
            if not hdfs.isdir(hdfs_base_path):
                # `os.path.normpath` return "." because aritifact_path is empty; 
                local_path = os.path.join(local_dir, os.path.normpath(artifact_path))
                _download_hdfs_file(hdfs, hdfs_base_path, local_path)
                return local_path
       ...
```

then open file on a directory will cause an error: 

```
/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/hdfs_artifact_repo.py in _download_hdfs_file(hdfs, remote_file_path, local_file_path)
    224     if not os.path.exists(dirs):
    225         os.makedirs(dirs)
--> 226     with open(local_file_path, "wb") as f:
    227         f.write(hdfs.open(remote_file_path, "rb").read())
```
